bibl.title: Despatch from Beverly Y. Payne to William F. Wharton, July 1, 1891
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p: Consulate General of the United States Monrovia, Liberia, July 1, 1891
Mr Beverly Y. Payne to the Department of State
Subject: Transmitting Accounts and returns for the quarter ended June 30, 1891
5 Consulate General of the United States. Monrovia, Liberia, July 1, 1891
Hon., William F. Wharton, Assistant Secretary of State Washington, D. C.

Sir: I have the honor respectfully to transmit the Accounts and returns of this Consulate General, for the quarter ended June 30, 1891, as per subjoined list of enclosures, which I trust you will find in order.
I have the honor to be, Sir: Your obedient Servant.
Beverly Y. Payne U.S. Vice Consul
1. Digest of Invoice Book. 2. Summary of business 3. Record of Treasury Fee 4. General Quarterly Account 5. Abstract of Contingent Expenses and vouchers (4)
